GOD.content: can a secret be transmitted? (yes & no); we do not understand, w/ Kierkegaard, Abraham’s decision; we share w/ Abraham what can’t be shared [highest passion, faith], a secret we know nothing about, neither him nor us > an incessant repetition of the absolute beginning
GOD.linkedContent: can a secret be transmitted? (yes & no); we do not understand, w/ Kierkegaard, Abraham’s decision; we share w/ Abraham what can’t be shared [highest passion, faith], a secret we know nothing about, neither him nor us > an incessant repetition of the absolute beginning

GOD.content: absolute secrecy,  a secret to keep as a shared inheritance of a secret that can’t be shared, absolute dissymmetry
GOD.linkedContent: absolute secrecy, a secret to keep as a shared inheritance of a secret that can’t be shared, absolute dissymmetry

GOD.content: secret letter becomes literature [Kafka] when it risks publicity, destinerrance, an archive to be inherited, when abandoned to its undecidability (is it the signature of father or son?)
GOD.linkedContent: secret letter becomes literature [Kafka] when it risks publicity, destinerrance, an archive to be inherited, when abandoned to its undecidability (is it the signature of father or son?)

GOD.content: w/ no witness, can only come down to us in the trace of an inheritance
GOD.linkedContent: w/ no witness, can only come down to us in the trace of an inheritance

GOD.content: plea for forgiveness in inheritance of God’s retraction; God’s retraction, a double coming-back, covenant only sealed through repetition [Noah is twice forgiven], God goes back on himself; dissymmetrical contract of Covenant supposes double trait of this retreat (re-trait) (Entzug)
GOD.linkedContent: plea for forgiveness in inheritance of God’s retraction; God’s retraction, a double coming-back, covenant only sealed through repetition [Noah is twice forgiven], God goes back on himself; dissymmetrical contract of Covenant supposes double trait of this retreat (re-trait) (Entzug)

GOD.content: singularity is sealed & betrayed by inheritance that confirms, reads, translates the covenant
GOD.linkedContent: singularity is sealed & betrayed by inheritance that confirms, reads, translates the covenant

GOD.content: literature inherits from Abraham, betrays him
GOD.linkedContent: literature inherits from Abraham, betrays him

GOD.content: properly phenomenological virtue of literature: puts thesis or arrest in quotations (parentheses) > literature’s relation to non-literary, religious remainder (Abrahamic moment), betrays in double sense of word: unfaithful to its history at moment it uncovers that history’s secret, reveals its “truth” (i.e. its [literature’s] own filiation) > literature must ask forgiveness for this double betrayal
GOD.linkedContent: properly phenomenological virtue of literature: puts thesis or arrest in quotations (parentheses) > literature’s relation to non-literary, religious remainder (Abrahamic moment), betrays in double sense of word: unfaithful to its history at moment it uncovers that history’s secret, reveals its “truth” (i.e. its [literature’s] own filiation) > literature must ask forgiveness for this double betrayal

GT.content: anthropologists returning to the good inheritance of primitive societies—nature
GT.linkedContent: anthropologists returning to the good inheritance of primitive societies—nature

GT.content: poisoned gifts of intellectual legacies, poison that never fails to call forth a counter-poison presented in guise of counter-gift
GT.linkedContent: poisoned gifts of intellectual legacies, poison that never fails to call forth a counter-poison presented in guise of counter-gift

GT.content: “Purloined Letter” & “Counterfeit Money” proceed from surplus-value of remnant or a superfluity of revenue (income or inheritance)
GT.linkedContent: “Purloined Letter” & “Counterfeit Money” proceed from surplus-value of remnant or a superfluity of revenue (income or inheritance)

R.content: [re: Greek word democracy] heirs, legatees, the legacy & the allegation (play btwn legare & legere), “sending or putting off (renvoi) gestures toward the past of an inheritance only by remaining to come”
R.linkedContent: [re: Greek word democracy] heirs, legatees, the legacy & the allegation (play btwn legare & legere), “sending or putting off (renvoi) gestures toward the past of an inheritance only by remaining to come”

R.content: [quoted in POOF] deconstruction guides us endlessly, orders us to engage, enjoins us to inherit a stance of survival coming through tired features (is this done in name of democracy?)
R.linkedContent: [quoted in POOF] deconstruction guides us endlessly, orders us to engage, enjoins us to inherit a stance of survival coming through tired features (is this done in name of democracy?)

R.content: abandoning inheritance/heritage of the name, in the name of the name, thereby betraying the heritage in the name of the heritage
R.linkedContent: abandoning inheritance/heritage of the name, in the name of the name, thereby betraying the heritage in the name of the heritage

H.content: urgent contemporary matters [new technologies] not only bring classical structures into present, they seem to deconstruct these inheritances of themselves
H.linkedContent: urgent contemporary matters [new technologies] not only bring classical structures into present, they seem to deconstruct these inheritances of themselves

AF.content: death drive destroys archives, anarchic, destroys its own trace, operates in silence
AF.linkedContent: death drive destroys archives, anarchic, destroys its own trace, operates in silence

AF.content: leaves no monument/document of its own > as inheritance, leaves on its erotic simulacrum (erogenous color draws mask on skin): origin of beautiful > memories of death
AF.linkedContent: leaves no monument/document of its own > as inheritance, leaves on its erotic simulacrum (erogenous color draws mask on skin): origin of beautiful > memories of death

AF.content: Yerushalmi would like be the first after Freud, alone in sharing a secret, an inheritor in lineage of arch-patriarchs [re: knowing Freud knew psychoanalysis was a Jewish science]
AF.linkedContent: Yerushalmi would like be the first after Freud, alone in sharing a secret, an inheritor in lineage of arch-patriarchs [re: knowing Freud knew psychoanalysis was a Jewish science]

AF.content: can only illuminate, interpret an inheritance by inscribing oneself w/in it
AF.linkedContent: can only illuminate, interpret an inheritance by inscribing oneself w/in it

SPOM.content: to learn-to-live w/ ghosts, in commerce w/out commerce of ghosts
SPOM.linkedContent: to learn-to-live w/ ghosts, in commerce w/out commerce of ghosts

SPOM.content: being-with specter a politics of memory, inheritance and generations
visor effect: “to feel ourselves seen by a look which it will always be impossible to cross” > the inheritance of law
SPOM.linkedContent: visor effect: “to feel ourselves seen by a look which it will always be impossible to cross” > the inheritance of law

SPOM.content: we are inheritors of plus d’une parole and an injunction (singular) that is disjointed
SPOM.linkedContent: we are inheritors of plus d’une parole and an injunction (singular) that is disjointed

SPOM.content: one must choose, filter different possibilities of inheritance
SPOM.linkedContent: one must choose, filter different possibilities of inheritance

SPOM.content: one always inherits around a secret
SPOM.linkedContent: one always inherits around a secret

SPOM.content: injunction of inheritance: “choose and decide from what you inherit” > this choice, like memory, the condition of finitude
SPOM.linkedContent: injunction of inheritance: “choose and decide from what you inherit” > this choice, like memory, the condition of finitude

SPOM.content: “one never inherits without coming to terms with [s’expliquer avec (battling with)] some specter, and therefore with more than one specter, with the fault and the injunction of plus d’un”
SPOM.linkedContent: “one never inherits without coming to terms with [s’expliquer avec (battling with)] some specter, and therefore with more than one specter, with the fault and the injunction of plus d’un”

SPOM.content: “inheritance is never a given, it is always a task”
SPOM.linkedContent: “inheritance is never a given, it is always a task”

SPOM.content: all questions on the subject of being are questions of inheritance, what is to be, what isn’t
SPOM.linkedContent: all questions on the subject of being are questions of inheritance, what is to be, what isn’t

SPOM.content: by mourning Marxism we inherit it
reaction, reactionary, one interpretation of inheritance
one cannot establish the state of a debt, do the balance sheet of an “exhaustive record,” one selects, performs, inheritance is kept secret, secret of a crime—of its very author
SPOM.linkedContent: one cannot establish the state of a debt, do the balance sheet of an “exhaustive record,” one selects, performs, inheritance is kept secret, secret of a crime—of its very author

SPOM.content: via Marx, more new erupts in revolutionary crisis, more “out of joint,” more one must convoke the old, inheritance borrows from “spirits of the past” > figurality as the figure of borrowing, borrowing speaks, question of credit, faith, fiduciary
SPOM.linkedContent: via Marx, more new erupts in revolutionary crisis, more “out of joint,” more one must convoke the old, inheritance borrows from “spirits of the past” > figurality as the figure of borrowing, borrowing speaks, question of credit, faith, fiduciary

SPOM.content: dividing line of figural inheritance: mechanical reproduction of specter, and “an appropriation…so alive, so interiorizing” that it is life as forgetting, forgetting the maternal, “to make spirit live in oneself”
SPOM.linkedContent: dividing line of figural inheritance: mechanical reproduction of specter, and “an appropriation…so alive, so interiorizing” that it is life as forgetting, forgetting the maternal, “to make spirit live in oneself”

SPOM.content: pre-inheritance, mother, on the basis of which one inherits; for Marx, 2 types of forgetting of pre-inheritance: 1) revolutionary 2) bourgeois
SPOM.linkedContent: pre-inheritance, mother, on the basis of which one inherits; for Marx, 2 types of forgetting of pre-inheritance: 1) revolutionary 2) bourgeois

SPOM.content: acc. Marx, parody > Louis Bonaparte > back-up ghost: fake magician > an inheritance that bequeaths, only, the alienation of self
SPOM.linkedContent: acc. Marx, parody > Louis Bonaparte > back-up ghost: fake magician > an inheritance that bequeaths, only, the alienation of self

HERP.content: as Dasein throws itself by anticipation toward death, it inherits & chooses, chooses the very possibility of inheritance (Kampf belongs to very structure of Dasein)
HERP.linkedContent: as Dasein throws itself by anticipation toward death, it inherits & chooses, chooses the very possibility of inheritance (Kampf belongs to very structure of Dasein)

HERP.content: deconstruction, or rather Heidegger’s Destruktion: appropriation of the tradition (while “destructing”), calls itself (heisst): “open our ear (unser Ohr öffnen)” [to a friend?]
HERP.linkedContent: deconstruction, or rather Heidegger’s Destruktion: appropriation of the tradition (while “destructing”), calls itself (heisst): “open our ear (unser Ohr öffnen)” [to a friend?]

VM.content: community of question, unbreachable (inentamable) responsibility, impossible has already occurred [beings, history] > there’s a history of the question, pure memory of pure question makes possible all inheritance, announces an injunction, discipline: question must be maintained
VM.linkedContent: community of question, unbreachable (inentamable) responsibility, impossible has already occurred [beings, history] > there’s a history of the question, pure memory of pure question makes possible all inheritance, announces an injunction, discipline: question must be maintained

PAS.content: the event adrift (en dérive) abducts (enlève) its simple past from an indefinite background of habitus or repetition, fond sans fond [quasi-now of récit]
PAS.linkedContent: the event adrift (en dérive) abducts (enlève) its simple past from an indefinite background of habitus or repetition, fond sans fond [quasi-now of récit]

POOF.content: the 3 ways to see virtue in Nietzsche: 1) deliberate perversion of heritage 2) restoration of meaning perverted by heritage 3) hyperbolic surenchère (more Greek than Greek, more Judeo-Christian than Judeo-Christian) > Nietzsche never discredits virtue
POOF.linkedContent: the 3 ways to see virtue in Nietzsche: 1) deliberate perversion of heritage 2) restoration of meaning perverted by heritage 3) hyperbolic surenchère (more Greek than Greek, more Judeo-Christian than Judeo-Christian) > Nietzsche never discredits virtue

POOF.content: inheriting the Greek, no actual rupture is possible, a heritage is affirmed provided it’s ‘still capable of being enriched’ > painful torsion of Greek friend, scarcely readable, is already full of contradiction > inherit Greek friend by contradicting it at heart of its contradiction
POOF.linkedContent: inheriting the Greek, no actual rupture is possible, a heritage is affirmed provided it’s ‘still capable of being enriched’ > painful torsion of Greek friend, scarcely readable, is already full of contradiction > inherit Greek friend by contradicting it at heart of its contradiction

FWT.content: heir must respond to double injunction: reaffirm what comes “before us,” necessary (il faut) to appropriate a past fundamentally inappropriable, reaffirm, relaunch otherwise, keep alive
FWT.linkedContent: heir must respond to double injunction: reaffirm what comes “before us,” necessary (il faut) to appropriate a past fundamentally inappropriable, reaffirm, relaunch otherwise, keep alive

FWT.content: reaffirmation which continues & interrupts: one’s own decision as that of the other: signature against signature
FWT.linkedContent: reaffirmation which continues & interrupts: one’s own decision as that of the other: signature against signature

FWT.content: we do not choose our inheritance, it violently elects us
FWT.linkedContent: we do not choose our inheritance, it violently elects us

FWT.content: think “life” on basis of heritage, not the other way around
FWT.linkedContent: think “life” on basis of heritage, not the other way around

FWT.content: deconstruction is hyperconceptual: large-scale consumption of concepts that it produces as much as it inherits
FWT.linkedContent: deconstruction is hyperconceptual: large-scale consumption of concepts that it produces as much as it inherits

FWT.content: contradictory tasks set to us by inheritance: testimony to our finitude, which obliges us to inherit older, more powerful, more durable, and same finitude obliges one to choose, select, sacrifice, exclude
FWT.linkedContent: contradictory tasks set to us by inheritance: testimony to our finitude, which obliges us to inherit older, more powerful, more durable, and same finitude obliges one to choose, select, sacrifice, exclude

FWT.content: [re: responsibility as experience of inheritance] a double before (devant), to come before as in debt and before as in what is to come, always anachronism: devancer in the name of what came before, and devancer the name itself! [la devance, “owingness”]
FWT.linkedContent: [re: responsibility as experience of inheritance] a double before (devant), to come before as in debt and before as in what is to come, always anachronism: devancer in the name of what came before, and devancer the name itself! [la devance, “owingness”]

FWT.content: to invent one’s name, sign otherwise, in the name of the name passed down, if that’s possible
FWT.linkedContent: to invent one’s name, sign otherwise, in the name of the name passed down, if that’s possible

FWT.content: heritage not only a double injunction or reaffirmation but a choice, filtering, heir not only receives but is one who risks choosing
FWT.linkedContent: heritage not only a double injunction or reaffirmation but a choice, filtering, heir not only receives but is one who risks choosing

FWT.content: infinite task of deconstruction to challenge limits of our heritage while drawing from it (pass, go beyond, w/out necessarily betraying) [re: human rights, ceaselessly transformed]
FWT.linkedContent: infinite task of deconstruction to challenge limits of our heritage while drawing from it (pass, go beyond, w/out necessarily betraying) [re: human rights, ceaselessly transformed]

FWT.content: we must always reaffirm something of the past to avoid relapse into something worse
FWT.linkedContent: we must always reaffirm something of the past to avoid relapse into something worse

DS.content: displacement w/out reversal of Platonic heritage, always an effect of syntax, writing, language—not simply dialectical overturning of concept (signified)
DS.linkedContent: displacement w/out reversal of Platonic heritage, always an effect of syntax, writing, language—not simply dialectical overturning of concept (signified)

OTO.content: only the name can inherit, so the name is always a dead man’s name
OTO.linkedContent: only the name can inherit, so the name is always a dead man’s name

ATIA.content: adding syllogistic “therefore” to The Animal That I Am (Follow): “such procedural steps (démarche) should be followed” [machine of inheritance] > to follow: seek to find, seek to escape?
ATIA.linkedContent: adding syllogistic “therefore” to The Animal That I Am (Follow): “such procedural steps (démarche) should be followed” [machine of inheritance] > to follow: seek to find, seek to escape?

SW.content: enough of inheriting amounts to same thing as enough of bequeathing
SW.linkedContent: enough of inheriting amounts to same thing as enough of bequeathing

SW.content: bookmark the fringes, they served once to accomplish a commandment, may another be accomplished w/ them [Kitsour…] > that’s what I’m doing, à contretemps, et signe et livre et date
SW.linkedContent: bookmark the fringes, they served once to accomplish a commandment, may another be accomplished w/ them [Kitsour…] > that’s what I’m doing, à contretemps, et signe et livre et date

SW.content: [read Cixous’ Savoir] only in a French to come, only happen in delayed form—inheriting w/out inheriting, reinventing mother & father [baby daddy]
SW.linkedContent: [read Cixous’ Savoir] only in a French to come, only happen in delayed form—inheriting w/out inheriting, reinventing mother & father [baby daddy]

PIO.content: does the child (son) invent himself specularly though parent’s narcissism > or is he an absolute invention (this being the truest response to parent’s desire): where truth is thought beyond any inheritance?
PIO.linkedContent: does the child (son) invent himself specularly though parent’s narcissism > or is he an absolute invention (this being the truest response to parent’s desire): where truth is thought beyond any inheritance?

TR.content: in every scene of inheritance, there’s laws of substitution (law period): responsibility, debt, duty—thus guilt & forgiveness
TR.linkedContent: in every scene of inheritance, there’s laws of substitution (law period): responsibility, debt, duty—thus guilt & forgiveness

TR.content: Rousseau’s interest in justice of inheritance/reading: responsible countersignature
TR.linkedContent: Rousseau’s interest in justice of inheritance/reading: responsible countersignature

WAP.content: one risks repeating Kant more naively, efficiently, clandestinely if one simply tries to skirt him (his philosophemes irrigate discourse underground)—can this paradoxical effect of capitalization be avoided?
WAP.linkedContent: one risks repeating Kant more naively, efficiently, clandestinely if one simply tries to skirt him (his philosophemes irrigate discourse underground)—can this paradoxical effect of capitalization be avoided?

WAP.content: heritage always surreptitiously bequeaths to us the means of interpreting it
WAP.linkedContent: heritage always surreptitiously bequeaths to us the means of interpreting it

HST.content: estate law, suppléant, substitute as inheritor, ensures surviving, inheritors have family resemblance but are not clones
HST.linkedContent: estate law, suppléant, substitute as inheritor, ensures surviving, inheritors have family resemblance but are not clones

HST.content: at heart of logic of substitution/supplement there’s apparently a crossing of natural reproduction & technological reproducibility, natural series & institutional deviation, natural filiation & adoption as legal fiction > unless this logic threatens/ruins opposition nature/institution
HST.linkedContent: at heart of logic of substitution/supplement there’s apparently a crossing of natural reproduction & technological reproducibility, natural series & institutional deviation, natural filiation & adoption as legal fiction > unless this logic threatens/ruins opposition nature/institution

C.content: coffin giving birth (a generator, genetrix): incalculable descendance [Phaedo]
C.linkedContent: coffin giving birth (a generator, genetrix): incalculable descendance [Phaedo]

C.content: intraitable (uncompromising) umbilicus of coffin, its tongs leave (laissent) a mark; so many leashes (laisses) > laisse: let see, let do, let fall, and to leave a legacy, lais [old form of legs, legacy]
C.linkedContent: intraitable (uncompromising) umbilicus of coffin, its tongs leave (laissent) a mark; so many leashes (laisses) > laisse: let see, let do, let fall, and to leave a legacy, lais [old form of legs, legacy]

TN.content: any inheritance or filiation worthy of such names: transform, re-begin, re-invent, divert, sometimes also betrayal (trahison)
TN.linkedContent: any inheritance or filiation worthy of such names: transform, re-begin, re-invent, divert, sometimes also betrayal (trahison)

CF.content: inherit a heritage w/ a double & contradictory injunction: reinvent memory w/out norm or criteria
CF.linkedContent: inherit a heritage w/ a double & contradictory injunction: reinvent memory w/out norm or criteria

SPEC.content: for Freud, one can inherit conceptual simulacra, counterfeit money [Nietzsche, Schopenhauer], but it is lacking in guaranteed value of psychoanalysis > Freud’s rationalization, his naive self-assurance re: counterfeit money, a scene of intolerable inheritance
SPEC.linkedContent: for Freud, one can inherit conceptual simulacra, counterfeit money [Nietzsche, Schopenhauer], but it is lacking in guaranteed value of psychoanalysis > Freud’s rationalization, his naive self-assurance re: counterfeit money, a scene of intolerable inheritance

SPEC.content: Derrida examining what is irreducible to “speculation” in an economy of a scene of writing: scene of inheritance implicating the Freuds and psychoanalytic “movement”
SPEC.linkedContent: Derrida examining what is irreducible to “speculation” in an economy of a scene of writing: scene of inheritance implicating the Freuds and psychoanalytic “movement”

SPEC.content: how can [Freud’s] autobiography give a worldwide (mondiale) institution its birth? what is autobiography if everything that follows from it is possible?
SPEC.linkedContent: how can [Freud’s] autobiography give a worldwide (mondiale) institution its birth? what is autobiography if everything that follows from it is possible?

SPEC.content: speculator can survive legatee of an autobiographical speculation, institution of movement w/out limit: mutism/death of legatee, one of the possibilities that dictates/causes legatee to write
SPEC.linkedContent: speculator can survive legatee of an autobiographical speculation, institution of movement w/out limit: mutism/death of legatee, one of the possibilities that dictates/causes legatee to write

SPEC.content: one gives oneself one’s own movement, one inherits from oneself all the time
SPEC.linkedContent: one gives oneself one’s own movement, one inherits from oneself all the time

SPEC.content: sufficient provisions so ghost can always step up to the cashier (passer à la caisse); all that’s necessary is to pronounce a name guaranteeing a signature, one thinks
SPEC.linkedContent: sufficient provisions so ghost can always step up to the cashier (passer à la caisse); all that’s necessary is to pronounce a name guaranteeing a signature, one thinks

SPEC.content: that which entraps speculation: murderous, mournful, jealous, guilty identifications [re: Freud’s relation to death of his & Ernst’s younger brother] > rigorous stricture, legacy & jealousy of a repetition (already jealous of itself) pull its [fort:da’s] strings (tirent les fils) more or less strictly > scene of writing becomes auto-bio-thanato-hetero-graphic
SPEC.linkedContent: that which entraps speculation: murderous, mournful, jealous, guilty identifications [re: Freud’s relation to death of his & Ernst’s younger brother] > rigorous stricture, legacy & jealousy of a repetition (already jealous of itself) pull its [fort:da’s] strings (tirent les fils) more or less strictly > scene of writing becomes auto-bio-thanato-hetero-graphic

SPEC.content: “transference (Übertragung)” attempts to reduce “resistances” of patient, only displaces resistance, operates a resistance, as a resistance > no legacy (legs) w/out transference > inheritance of transference, legs, legation, delegation, differance of transference
SPEC.linkedContent: “transference (Übertragung)” attempts to reduce “resistances” of patient, only displaces resistance, operates a resistance, as a resistance > no legacy (legs) w/out transference > inheritance of transference, legs, legation, delegation, differance of transference

SPEC.content: demonic in scene of writing/inheritance: en se précédant de son annonce auprès de qui tient lieu prêt pour sa revenue [announcement for those who will hold its place when it comes back] > hope that message will become archival, or indestructible monument of interrupted en-voie
SPEC.linkedContent: demonic in scene of writing/inheritance: en se précédant de son annonce auprès de qui tient lieu prêt pour sa revenue [announcement for those who will hold its place when it comes back] > hope that message will become archival, or indestructible monument of interrupted en-voie

SPEC.content: document is ciphered, will remain secret if author dies before “his own (les siens),” all “his own” will be those who believe they can decipher the will (testament) of this code
SPEC.linkedContent: document is ciphered, will remain secret if author dies before “his own (les siens),” all “his own” will be those who believe they can decipher the will (testament) of this code

SPEC.content: Freud’s  metaphor of the “vesicle,” protoplasmic bulb, amortizes excitations from outside world [and inside], protects, can be transferred to every corpus [i.e. text]: transference from one legatee to the other, like the simulacrum of secret
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud’s metaphor of the “vesicle,” protoplasmic bulb, amortizes excitations from outside world [and inside], protects, can be transferred to every corpus [i.e. text]: transference from one legatee to the other, like the simulacrum of secret

SPEC.content: Vorbilder (models), necessity of metaphoric detour whenever Freud doesn’t know what he’s talking about re: interminable band, contra-band, quantity of binding—so he uses rhetoric of code, message, envoi, postal network
SPEC.linkedContent: Vorbilder (models), necessity of metaphoric detour whenever Freud doesn’t know what he’s talking about re: interminable band, contra-band, quantity of binding—so he uses rhetoric of code, message, envoi, postal network

SPEC.content: demonic, archive of its own demon: undissolved transference, like unpaid debt of inheritance, one can begin an inheritance thus: laissée en sommeil, la menace ainsi enkystée [pocket]
SPEC.linkedContent: demonic, archive of its own demon: undissolved transference, like unpaid debt of inheritance, one can begin an inheritance thus: laissée en sommeil, la menace ainsi enkystée [pocket]

SPEC.content: but S is never P [re: Freud’s death drive], since heterology is involved, there’s force & thus legacy, sending, envoi: the proper is not the proper
SPEC.linkedContent: but S is never P [re: Freud’s death drive], since heterology is involved, there’s force & thus legacy, sending, envoi: the proper is not the proper

FV.content: [Lacan on properly inheriting, following the letter of Freud]
FV.linkedContent: [Lacan on properly inheriting, following the letter of Freud]

FV.content: dead king, Freud, only one to contract w/ himself, awaits restitution > restoration: carrying off last plume w/ his 1st hand [in dying, mobilizes many]: theory of the facteurs
FV.linkedContent: dead king, Freud, only one to contract w/ himself, awaits restitution > restoration: carrying off last plume w/ his 1st hand [in dying, mobilizes many]: theory of the facteurs

FV.content: [profiting from remnant] by means of a remnant of paternal inheritance, one the debtors left out of account, Dupin draws revenue, surplus-value of a capital that works by itself, calculating (rigorous economy) > Dupin can pay for a sole luxury [Dupin’s desire to read]: cuts across restricted economy like gift w/out return
FV.linkedContent: [profiting from remnant] by means of a remnant of paternal inheritance, one the debtors left out of account, Dupin draws revenue, surplus-value of a capital that works by itself, calculating (rigorous economy) > Dupin can pay for a sole luxury [Dupin’s desire to read]: cuts across restricted economy like gift w/out return
